subject: Personal Finance
title: Why Gold Won
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Gold Won.

hook.text: Humans could have chosen silver, copper, or platinum. Gold won the currency contest.

buildup.text: Gold doesn't rust, tarnish, or react with other elements. It's chemically almost indestructible.

discovery.text: It's rare enough to be valuable but common enough to actually use as currency.

twist.text: Gold is also soft enough to stamp into coins and visually distinct. It practically markets itself.

climax.text: Most other elements fail at least one test. Gold passes them all by an unlikely chemical accident.

punchline.text: Chemistry chose gold. Humans just agreed.

quiz.question: Why did gold become the preferred monetary metal?
options: It's durable, rare enough, and easy to work with
